column4: Tyring to install sun-java6-jdk and I'm not having any luck. already enabled the partner repositories in sources and I I get this error message in Synaptic: Package sun-java6-jdk has no available version, but exists in the database. This typically means that the package was mentioned in a dependency and never uploaded, has been obsoleted or is not available with the contents of sources.list
Let me ask it another way -- HOW do I install sun-java6.jdk on 10.04?
err, sun-java6-jdk rather
you need to add the partner repository
already did that. doesn't work
I've enabled the partner repositories, updated apt, tried to install from both the CLI and Synaptic. Both fail

Package sun-java6-jdk has no available version, but exists in the database. This typically means that the package was mentioned in a dependency and never uploaded, has been obsoleted or is not available with the contents of sources.list
sorry that was synaptic
http://pastebin.com/6a7qcL0i
Replacing the sun jdk with openjdk was a fail. I'm sure there's all sorts of magical reasons for it, but I think that was a bad move
sigh
the partner repositories ARE enabled
Sun dropped support for their jdk? Or do you mean just the Linux version?
pastebin your /etc/apt/sources.list
http://pastebin.com/GXpu8Zz7
you have karmic partner not lucid
change karmic to lucid in the partner lines and apt-get update; and it will work

didn't actually read it. just uncommented it
